summaries.brief_summary: Merlin dev tool support, duplicate dependency warnings, cache location fixes, extensive trace event improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: Merlin dev tool support, duplicate dependency warnings, workspace binaries in env stanza, smarter float printing
summaries.new_features:
- **Merlin support** added to `dune tools` by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal), enabling automated installation and management of Merlin as a dev tool similar to ocamlformat and odoc ([#12972](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12972))
- **Duplicate dependency warnings** now emitted when package definitions contain duplicate package names in dependencies by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) ([#12861](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12861), [#12986](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12986), fixes [#2678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2678))
- **Workspace binaries** introduced via `(env (binaries ..))` stanzas now properly resolved when generating rules for `./.bin` directory by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#12952](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12952), fixes [#6220](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/6220))
- **Cache location changes**: toolchains and revision store caches now respect `DUNE_CACHE_ROOT` environment variable instead of only `XDG_CACHE_HOME` by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12858](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12858), fixes [#11584](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11584))
- **Float printing** in `Dyn.to_string` now uses smarter precision to ensure round-trip capability and valid OCaml lexemes by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12982](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12982), fixes [#12980](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12980))
- **RPC promotion warnings** now properly transferred to client in RPC mode by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604), fixes [#12578](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12578))
- **Nested dune call execution environment** fixed to properly handle package management by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) ([#12935](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12935))
- **Trace event system enhancements** including final event emission on exit ([#13018](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13018)), process ID and initial working directory in config events ([#13026](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13026)), process categories moved to args field ([#13024](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13024)), and new config and async event categories ([#13021](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13021), [#13022](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13022)) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg)
- **Cram test lexer** now allows `>>` characters in continuations by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12969](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12969))
- **Dev tools compiler packages** no longer hardcoded, improving flexibility by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) ([#12834](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12834))
- **Documentation updates**: cache documentation reorganized and expanded to explain all cache types ([#12983](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12983)), forge name casing corrected to GitHub, GitLab, SourceHut ([#12994](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12994)), `-p` flag documentation fixed ([#13006](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13006))
summaries.activity_summary: Twelve new PRs opened including dev tool error improvements, cram timeout promotion, directory message suppression
summaries.activity:
- **Twelve new PRs opened** this week that haven't merged yet: improved error message when running uninstalled dev tools by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) ([#12978](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12978)), cram test partial promotion on timeout ([#12977](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12977)), relative path support in `dune install --prefix` ([#12993](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12993)), odoc v3 rules by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#12995](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12995)), structured logging framework ([#13015](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13015)), cram setup_scripts documentation ([#13010](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13010)), reproduction test for multiple pin-depends bug by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12991](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12991)), and directory message suppression when no output by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12974](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12974))
- **Test infrastructure improvements** dominated the week with systematic removal of `_build/log` parsing from test suite by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg), including coq tests ([#13016](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13016), [#13028](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13028)) and general cleanup ([#12999](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12999), [#12989](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12989), [#13002](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13002)), test verbosity reduction ([#12968](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12968), [#12967](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12967)), cram test cleanup ([#13013](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13013)), nix test dependencies cleanup ([#13012](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13012)), portable sed functionality ([#13008](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13008)), shell portability improvements ([#13003](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13003)), and package test setup scripts ([#13009](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13009))
- **Internal refactoring** including removal of `set_log_file` ([#12987](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12987)), `Path.to_string` wrapper simplification by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) ([#12970](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12970)), `Path.link` moved to `Fpath.link` ([#12966](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12966)), `Let_syntax` moved to own module ([#13017](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13017)), stdune log simplification ([#13014](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13014)), float to `Time.t` and `Time.Span.t` refactoring ([#13029](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13029)), package rules database optimization to prevent recreation by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12872](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12872)), and trace event timestamp generation code reduction ([#13019](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13019), [#13020](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13020), [#13023](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13023), [#13025](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13025))
- **Nix infrastructure updates** by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) including flake updates for OPAM 2.5 ([#12961](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12961)), OCaml package override centralization ([#12962](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12962)), and binaries test fixes ([#12971](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12971))
- **Additional improvements** including scheduler refactoring ([#12958](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12958)), directory loading debug event ([#12959](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12959)), hidden deps testing via trace ([#12965](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12965)), nested dune test emulation improvements ([#12916](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12916)), binaries env stanza behavior tests ([#12960](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12960)), cram lexer crash test ([#12963](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12963)), print directory test ([#12973](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12973)), and `include_subdirs` interaction tests by [Nicolas Jeannerod](https://github.com/Niols) ([#7629](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7629))
summaries.discussions_summary: Active discussion on n2-style live progress display, performance optimizations for release builds, package management concerns
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Merlin dev tool support** sparked extensive design discussion with 34 comments on [#12972](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12972) covering implementation approach, test coverage, environment handling, and integration with existing tooling
- **Duplicate dependency warnings** evolved through multiple iterations with 17 comments on [#12861](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12861) addressing error vs warning approach, hint message formatting, and proper use of warning mechanisms, ultimately leading to revert ([#12984](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12984)) and reimplementation ([#12986](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12986))
- **Dev tool error messages** under active review with 14 comments on [#12978](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12978) discussing clearer error reporting when running uninstalled dev tools
- **Hardcoded compiler packages** removal debated in 14 comments on [#12834](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12834) examining dev tools architecture and package dependencies
- **Nested dune execution environment** refined through 12 comments on [#12935](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12935) addressing package management interaction with nested builds
- **Cache documentation** improvements discussed in 11 comments on [#12983](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12983) clarifying cache types, locations, and migration guidance
- **Forge name casing** corrections attracted 11 comments on [#12994](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12994) discussing proper capitalization for GitHub, GitLab, and SourceHut
- **n2-style live progress display** RFC generated 8 comments on [#12992](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12992) exploring terminal UI improvements inspired by ninja build tool
- **Performance optimization proposal** for skipping cache writes with `-p` flag drew 7 comments on [#13004](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13004) examining build-time improvements for package releases
- **Float printing precision** feature request discussion on [#12982](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12982) with 6 comments addressing round-trip serialization requirements
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on developer tooling infrastructure, test suite modernization, trace event system refinement, package management UX
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Developer tools ecosystem** expanding with Merlin joining ocamlformat and odoc as managed dev tools, alongside improvements to error messages ([#12978](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12978)) and compiler package flexibility ([#12834](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12834)), reflecting broader push for integrated development environment support
- **Test infrastructure modernization** removing legacy `_build/log` parsing dependencies across the entire test suite ([#12999](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12999), [#12989](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12989), [#13016](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13016), [#13028](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13028)) while improving portability ([#13003](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13003), [#13008](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13008)) and reducing verbosity ([#12968](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12968), [#12967](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12967))
- **Trace event system evolution** with systematic improvements to event structure ([#13024](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13024), [#13025](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13025)), new event types ([#13018](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13018), [#13026](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13026)), and category organization ([#13021](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13021), [#13022](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13022), [#13020](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13020)), suggesting ongoing work toward comprehensive build observability
- **Package management UX concerns** raised by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) including `dune clean` behavior ([#12976](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12976)), dependency update unpredictability ([#13011](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13011)), dev tool installation suggestions ([#12975](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12975)), and multiple pin-depends bugs ([#12990](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12990), [#12991](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12991))
- **Performance optimization proposals** emerging around release builds including skipping cache writes with `-p` flag ([#13004](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13004)) and avoiding merlin file generation in release mode ([#13005](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13005))
- **Documentation quality improvements** with systematic corrections to forge names ([#12994](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12994)), cache organization documentation ([#12983](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12983)), and flag documentation fixes ([#13006](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13006))

summaries.brief_summary: Major tracing infrastructure refactoring, new file visibility controls, DUNE_JOBS env var, and extensive performance optimizations
summaries.new_features_summary: New (files) stanza, DUNE_JOBS environment variable, enhanced trace events, and workspace binary handling fixes
summaries.new_features:
- New `(files)` stanza to control file visibility on a per-directory basis, similar to the existing `(dirs)` stanza ([#12879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12879) by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb))
- New `DUNE_JOBS` environment variable for controlling Dune concurrency, replacing the previous behavior where `INSIDE_DUNE` controlled concurrency ([#12800](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12800) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- Trace events now include `argv`, process environment, and Dune version in config event ([#12909](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12909) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- Workspace root added to config trace event ([#12922](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12922) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- New promotion trace event replacing verbose log message ([#12949](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12949) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- New target resolution trace event replacing equivalent log message ([#12955](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12955) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- `--trace-extended` flag removed as its functionality is now always enabled when tracing is active ([#12908](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12908) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- Fixed workspace binaries not being accounted for when generating rules for `./.bin` ([#12952](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12952) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) fixing [#6220](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/6220))
- Fixed duplicate dependencies warning ([#12861](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12861) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) fixing [#2678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2678))
- Fixed FreeBSD build by tweaking lmdb stubs ([#12926](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12926) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- Fixed RPC not transferring promotion warnings to client ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604) by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) fixing [#12578](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12578))
- OxCaml parameterised inline tests support ([#12707](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12707) by [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi))
- Solution logging improvements for package management autolocking ([#12871](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12871) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV), [#12898](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12898))
- Tutorial updated to use autolocking ([#12859](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12859) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV))
- New tutorial for setting up OxCaml projects with dune pkg ([#12780](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12780) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV))
summaries.activity_summary: Extensive tracing modernization, performance optimizations across core data structures, package management improvements, and platform compatibility fixes
summaries.activity:
- **Newly opened PRs** include support for multiple stanzas in `dune-file` rules and `dune.inc` generation without dependency edges by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) ([#12964](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12964)), directory loading debug event by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12959](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12959)), hidden deps flags testing via trace by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12965](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12965)), and several others
- **Tracing and logging infrastructure** underwent extensive refactoring with trace events moving to `dune_trace` module ([#12867](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12867) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg)), persistent DB and process events restructured ([#12938](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12938), [#12940](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12940), [#12942](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12942), [#12943](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12943), [#12932](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12932), [#12930](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12930)), and `Stdune.Log` module introduced ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12912))
- **Performance optimizations** delivered through `Lib.compare` optimization ([#12928](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12928)), appendable list compactness maintenance ([#12936](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12936), [#12934](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12934)), library hashing using IDs ([#12889](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12889)), ocaml-index memoization ([#12894](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12894), [#12918](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12918)), and parsing hot path string equality optimizations ([#12874](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12874), [#12876](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12876), [#12881](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12881))
- **Package management improvements** with toolchains using `DUNE_CACHE_ROOT` instead of `XDG_CACHE_HOME` ([#12858](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12858) by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS)), Pkg_rules.DB values not being recreated ([#12872](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12872) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), solver environment memoization ([#12918](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12918)), and opam template copy rules fixed for fs-io and top-closure ([#12954](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12954) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) fixing [#12947](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12947))
- **Build infrastructure updates** including OCaml version bump from 5.3 to 5.4 ([#12885](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12885), [#12951](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12951) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro)), ocamlformat bump to 0.28.1 ([#12937](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12937) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), Nix flake-utils dependency removed ([#12945](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12945) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro)), and copyfile stubs fixed for Alpine Linux ([#12901](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12901) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) fixing [#12896](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12896))
- **Cram test improvements** with lexing fix for single space comments after output ([#12903](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12903) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) fixing [#12899](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12899))
- **Module compilation** split into separate flags and pp flags for increased sharing ([#12950](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12950) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- **Code cleanups** including json library removal ([#12906](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12906)), `Dune_log` removing `This` ([#12910](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12910)), `Dune_util` stop re-exporting unix ([#12911](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12911)), and chrome_trace hiding from public API ([#12890](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12890))
summaries.discussions_summary: Platform-specific build issues, dev tools reliability concerns, and package management feature requests dominated discussions
summaries.notable_discussions:
- Alpine Linux copyfile stubs failure discussion highlighted platform-specific build issues requiring kernel header workarounds ([#12896](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12896) with 5 comments)
- Dev tools installation environment breakage risk discussed, noting that failed tool installs can corrupt user environments on BSD systems ([#12818](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12818) with 5 comments)
- Package installation with test dependencies (`fs-io` and `top-closure`) failing with `with-tests` flag was identified as a regression since 3.20 release ([#12947](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12947) with 4 comments)
- General tool installation support feature request advocates for removing hard-coded dev tools requirement, proposing that only special-case tools like utop and ocamllsp need custom handling ([#12913](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12913) with 4 comments by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder))
- Selective package lock upgrading discussed as users need ability to update specific packages without resolving entire lock ([#12820](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12820) with 4 comments by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder))
summaries.trends_summary: Clear focus on tracing infrastructure modernization, systematic performance optimization campaign, package management maturation, and platform support improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Tracing infrastructure modernization** is a clear focus with extensive refactoring moving away from ad-hoc logging to structured trace events, including removing `--trace-extended` flag, consolidating events in `dune_trace` module, and adding rich context like process environment and workspace root to trace data
- **Performance optimization campaign** targeting core data structures and hot paths with improvements to library comparison, appendable lists, parsing, and index memoization showing coordinated effort to reduce overhead
- **Package management maturation** continues with autolocking documentation, solution logging improvements, toolchains cache location standardization, and bug fixes for platform-specific issues
- **Platform support improvements** addressing FreeBSD build failures, Alpine Linux compatibility, and OCaml 5.4 readiness demonstrating commitment to broad platform support

summaries.brief_summary: Feature additions, OxCaml fixes, performance optimizations, and improved error messages across version parsing and package management
summaries.new_features_summary: Variable expansion in promote rules, horizontal scrolling in TUI, cram test setup scripts, improved error messages for version formats
summaries.new_features:
- **Variable expansion** in `(promote (into ..))` enables dynamic control of promotion destinations using variables like `%{env:VAR}` ([#12832](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12832) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro), fixes [#12742](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12742))
- **Horizontal mouse scrolling** support added to TUI scrollbox widget through notty vendor update ([#12386](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12386) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- **Setup scripts** field for cram tests enables initialization scripts to run before test execution ([#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- **Improved error messages** for invalid version formats with clearer "Version must be two numbers separated by a dot" message replacing cryptic "Atom of the form NNN.NNN expected" ([#12833](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12833), [#12844](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12844) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal))
- **Non-ASCII character detection** in version strings now provides clear error message at lexer level: "Invalid atom: contains non-ASCII character(s)" ([#12844](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12844) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal), fixes [#12836](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12836))
- **Error location precision** fixed for version parsing to avoid misaligned carets with multi-byte UTF-8 characters ([#12869](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12869) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal), fixes [#12806](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12806))
- **Better guidance** when `(pkg enabled)` is mistakenly placed in `dune-project` instead of `dune-workspace` ([#12802](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12802) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal), fixes [#12801](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12801))
- **Project template improvements** with `dune init proj` now generating test stanzas that depend on the project library ([#12791](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12791) by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder), closes [#12716](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12716))
- **Performance optimization** through defunctionalized sexp decoder enabling closure removal and tail-call optimization ([#12768](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12768) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- **Package context memoization** significantly improves build performance in projects with many dependencies ([#12848](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12848) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), 70% faster on ocaml-cohttp)
- **OxCaml preprocessor fix** resolves instantiation issues with preprocessed modules having `.pp.ml` extensions ([#12843](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12843) by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w))
- **Documentation additions** including how-to guides for configuring dev-tools lock directories ([#12837](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12837)), editor configuration ([#12810](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12810)), and homebrew packaging with dune pkg ([#12744](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12744))

summaries.brief_summary: Rocq Prover support added, Coq mode deprecated, new promotion show command, compiler warning defaults changed
summaries.new_features_summary: Rocq build language, dune promotion show command, compiler warning variable, SSH repository URLs, dev-tool lock dir variable
summaries.new_features:
- **Rocq Prover build language** support via `(lang rocq)` for Rocq 9.0 and later, providing similar functionality to `(lang coq)` without requiring `coq*` compatibility wrappers ([#12035](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12035))
- **Coq mode deprecation** in favor of Rocq mode, with development frozen on `(lang coq)` which will be removed in future versions ([#12793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12793))
- **`dune promotion show` command** to preview corrected files before promotion, accepting file arguments or displaying all promotable files ([#12669](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12669))
- **`dune rocq top` command** to execute Rocq toplevel with local configuration ([f783f81](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/f783f81731da4ecb307981bc61117f07c1b3b953))
- **Compiler warning defaults changed** for Dune language 3.21+ to match OCaml compiler defaults, with `%{dune-warnings}` variable available to restore previous stricter warning set ([#12766](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12766))
- **SSH repository URLs** documentation for Git-based package repositories in workspace files ([#12790](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12790))
- **Dev-tool lock directory variable** `%{dev-tool-lock-dir}` added to reference lock directory location ([#12779](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12779))
- **Dev-tool lock directories** moved into hidden `.dune/dev-tools-locks/` folder by default ([#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12671))
- **Improved error messages** for invalid version strings in `dune-project` files with helpful hints showing correct format ([#12794](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12794))
- **Module compilation dependency fix** adding dependency to original source file ([#12774](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12774))
- **Unused libraries detection** improvements for runtime dependencies ([#12786](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12786), [#12807](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12807))
- **Cram stanza empty match** fix when cram stanza applies to no files ([#12814](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12814))
- **Action builder alias module** refactoring ([#12772](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12772))
- **Read-only promotion revert** reverting changes that made promoted files read-only ([#12808](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12808))
- **Documentation improvements** including dune-workspace syntax highlighting ([#12803](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12803)), opam-alongside-pkg workflow guide ([#12761](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12761)), variable reference updates, and repository SSH URL documentation
- **Unused experimental libraries removed** including dune-*-experimental packages ([#12765](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12765), [#12823](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12823))
- **GitHub Actions updates** with actions/checkout bumped from 5 to 6 ([#12778](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12778))
- **Re-exports bug demonstration** test case added ([#12783](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12783))
- **Config comparison fix** for incorrect configuration comparisons ([#12781](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12781))

summaries.brief_summary: OxCaml parameterised library instantiation merged, package management improvements, and warning system changes proposed
summaries.new_features_summary: OxCaml parameterised library instantiation, improved archive extraction errors, cmdliner doc enforcement
summaries.new_features:
- **OxCaml parameterised library instantiation** by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) enables instantiating parameterised libraries with arguments using syntax like `(foo bar qux)` or `(foo bar qux :as new_name)`, with automatic parameter inheritance and comprehensive documentation ([#12561](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12561))
- **Better error messages for archive extraction failures** by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) now explicitly reports when required tools like `unzip` are missing from PATH ([#12683](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12683), fixes [#11548](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11548))
- **Explicit documentation arguments for cmdliner** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) enforces that all CLI commands have explicit `doc` parameters, reducing undocumented arguments across 45 files ([#12728](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12728))
- **Windows filesystem watcher use-after-free fix** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) resolves memory safety issue in fswatch_win component ([#12757](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12757))
- **Package management memoization** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) optimizes lock directory access to avoid redundant reads ([#12758](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12758))
- **Opam version 2.2.0 solver reporting** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) ensures dune reports the correct opam version during package solving ([#12721](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12721))
- **Documentation for `--alias` and `--alias-rec` flags** added to help users build aliases with paths ([#12729](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12729), addresses [#12722](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12722))
- **Binary distribution guide** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) shows how to release application binaries on GitHub using dune package management and GitHub Actions ([#12745](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12745))
- **ocamlobjinfo parser robustness** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) fixed to continue parsing when encountering unrecognized lines rather than stopping ([#12767](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12767))
- **Dev tool dependencies fix** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) corrects utop package dependency computation for dune package management ([#12747](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12747))

summaries.brief_summary: Package management maturation with portable lockdirs and autolocking enabled by default, plus Coq/Rocq improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: Portable lockdirs, autolocking, unused libraries detection, dune describe tests, artifact variables, CoqProject generation
summaries.new_features:
- **Portable lockdirs enabled by default** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), making lock directories work across different platforms and detecting whether a lockdir is portable ([#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680))
- **Autolocking feature** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), allowing building package dependencies without running `dune pkg lock` first when `(pkg enabled)` is in dune-workspace ([#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653))
- **Unused libraries detection** via new `@unused-libs` alias by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) to detect unused library dependencies ([#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623))
- **New `dune describe tests` command** by [Leitao -- Pereira Dias Rodrigue](https://github.com/Gromototo) providing comprehensive test metadata ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545))
- **Artifact variables `%{cmt:...}` and `%{cmti:...}`** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for referencing compiled annotation files with typed AST ([#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634))
- **PPX pform `%{ppx:lib1+..+libn}`** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) for referring to ppx executables in tests ([#12711](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12711))
- **Package build progress enabled by default** by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan), now respecting display settings ([#12695](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12695))
- **CoqProject file generation** by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with opt-in `(generate_project_file)` in coq.theory stanza for better editor support ([#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752))
- **Coqdoc header and footer customization** by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) with new `coqdoc_header` and `coqdoc_footer` fields ([#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131))
- **Multiple modules in modules_flags for Coq** by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre), fixing bug that only allowed single module ([#12733](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12733))
- **Better git error messages** by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) showing git output when Rev_store fetch fails ([#12673](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12673))
- **Non-platform-specific solver variables in portable lockdirs** by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), fixing issue where variables like `with-doc` were incorrectly omitted ([#12678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12678))
- **Cram test location tracking** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for better error messages, including conflict markers ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720))
- **ocaml-index as dev tool** by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) ensuring ocaml-index is available for `@ocaml-index` alias ([#12706](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12706))
- **Documentation improvements** including opam file templates ([#12710](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12710)), Coq support ([#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752)), and artifact variables ([#12634](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12634))
summaries.activity_summary: Ongoing work on RPC fixes, package management refinements, and performance investigations including a reported 3-order magnitude regression
summaries.activity:
- **Package management refinements** including fix for lock directory assumptions ([#12712](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12712) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), solver environment consistency for autolock ([#12719](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12719) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), opam version reporting ([#12721](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12721) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs)), SSH URL support ([#12701](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12701) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), and chrome tracing stat events ([#12724](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12724) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- **RPC and watch mode fixes** by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) addressing promotion handling issues ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604) fixing [#12578](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12578) and [#12577](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12577)), eager watch mode promotion registration ([#12726](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12726) reproducing [#12725](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12725)), and non-deterministic hanging ([#12715](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12715))
- **Documentation and tooling** with alias documentation PR ([#12729](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12729) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), cmdliner improvements ([#12728](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12728) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), cram test setup scripts ([#12650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12650) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg)), and Emacs integration ([#12696](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12696))
- **Testing infrastructure** including new `dune runtest` functionality for tests stanzas ([#12689](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12689) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), promotion improvements ([#12669](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12669), [#12615](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12615)), timeout locations ([#12657](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12657)), and build lock warning ([#12687](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12687))
- **Coq/Rocq testing** with Rocq 9.1.0 CI tests in progress ([#12734](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12734) by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre))
- **Bug fixes and refinements** including better unzip error messages ([#12683](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12683) by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247)), dev-tool lock directory organization ([#12671](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12671)), and cache location standardization ([#11612](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11612))
summaries.discussions_summary: Controversial concurrent builds proposal and portable lockdirs UX discussions
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Concurrent builds proposal** ([#12731](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12731)) by [Joel Reymont](https://github.com/joelreymont) proposing removal of global build lock with claims of 2-5x faster IDE and 50% faster CI, generating debate about AI-assisted development and requiring team discussion with reference implementation in [#12730](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12730)
- **Portable lockdirs UX** ([#11868](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11868)) with extensive discussion by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) and community about platform targeting strategies and proposal refinements
- **dune pkg outdated semantics** ([#12732](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12732)) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) debating whether the command should solve and compare versus current simpler implementation
- **Performance regression** ([#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693)) reported by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) showing 3 orders of magnitude slowdown in no-op builds with pkg (13s vs 850ms), requiring investigation
summaries.trends_summary: Package management maturation, Coq/Rocq ecosystem investment, performance focus, and testing infrastructure improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Package management reaching production readiness** with portable lockdirs ([#12680](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12680)) and autolocking ([#12653](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12653)) enabled by default, moving dune pkg toward stable release
- **Coq/Rocq ecosystem support expansion** through CoqProject generation ([#11752](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11752)), coqdoc customization ([#11131](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11131)), bug fixes ([#12733](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12733)), and Rocq 9.1.0 testing ([#12734](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12734))
- **Performance optimization focus** with regression investigation ([#12693](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12693)), chrome tracing improvements ([#12724](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12724)), and concurrent builds proposal ([#12731](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12731))
- **Developer experience improvements** including better error messages ([#12673](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12673), [#12683](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12683)), location tracking ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720)), unused library warnings ([#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)), and test introspection ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545))
- **Testing infrastructure investment** with cram test improvements ([#12335](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12335), [#12720](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12720), [#12657](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12657)), new test commands ([#12545](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12545), [#12689](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12689)), and ppx testing tools ([#12711](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12711))
- **Long-standing issue resolution** with closure of 2018 issue about unused library warnings ([#650](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/650)) via [#12623](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12623)

summaries.brief_summary: Package management improvements dominated with portable lockdirs, error deduplication, and cross-device link fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed hidden module handling, documented allow_empty field, improved cross-device link handling in pkg
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed `-H` flag usage for **hidden modules** to pass private modules correctly when available ([#12666](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12666), [a6d7819](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/a6d78193c439e443776203c25014377dd35c2f86))
- Added **documentation for `(allow_empty)` field** in dune-project package stanzas, allowing packages with no user-defined stanzas ([#5567](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/5567), [#12691](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12691), [9eeb3ce](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9eeb3ce07986540b99dd1e6206a733579905783d))
- Implemented **cross-device link error handling** for package lock directories by falling back to copy+delete when rename fails with EXDEV ([#11644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11644), [#12649](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12649), [3403f4c](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/3403f4cd7888324183b84bd72204ae57794da726))
- **Error deduplication** for portable lockdirs including manifest errors and opam parse errors ([#12670](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12670), [#12684](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12684), [f3c70f0](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/f3c70f02279388daa742e56371bfc5eb5261a4b6), [7590f37](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/7590f37acabb4f291846a9485665f93893eb58e6))
- Improved **runtest error messages** with better hints for cram tests and deduplication of test candidates ([#12663](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12663), [0745951](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/07459510d5f7a8d6fab10845f6cc365cbbcad587))
- Added **avoid-version message** display for portable lockdir solving ([#12679](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12679), [b202280](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/b202280451141e33ecd99e831ccc576028eb0f7b))
- RPC system **refactoring** with `fire_notification` function to simplify shutdown handling and remove duplicate code ([#12675](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12675), [#12674](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12674), [#12672](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12672), [c236cb6](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/c236cb66c2c3bc8f129490dbc0f7c7199b420b49))

summaries.brief_summary: Package management improvements for portable lockdirs, Melange documentation overhaul, and cram test enhancements
summaries.new_features_summary: Portable lockdir solver improvements with deduplication and platform grouping, ocamlformat auto-relocking, Melange @all alias
summaries.new_features:
- **Portable lockdirs** now display **dependency solutions grouped by platform** with clear indication of common and platform-specific packages ([#12620](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12620))
- **Solver errors deduplicated** when generating portable lockdirs to avoid repeating identical error messages across multiple platforms ([#12642](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12642))
- **Package validation fixed** for portable lockdirs to correctly validate packages when multiple platforms are involved ([#12640](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12640))
- **ocamlformat auto-relocking** now triggers when `.ocamlformat` version changes, ensuring dev tools stay synchronized ([#12605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12605))
- **Dev tool lock directory validation** now detects missing or corrupted entries and provides clear error messages with automatic relocking ([be54d96](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/be54d96f37fab5eaf7f2f3f77750085a55e743dc))
- **Windows arm64 removed** from default portable lockdir platforms since package management doesn't support Windows yet ([#12641](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12641))
- **Melange module compilation** added to `@all` alias in libraries, fixing build workflow issues ([#12628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12628))
- **Virtual library implementation** bug fixed for `dune build @check` that was causing crashes when virtual modules were present ([#12644](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12644))
- **Cram test conflict markers** now allow text after markers and renamed `(conflict error|ignore)` option to `(conflict_markers error|ignore)` for clarity ([#12655](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12655), [#12651](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12651))
- **Melange documentation completely overhauled** for `(using melange 1.0)` with improved examples, promotion workflow explanation, and updated stanza documentation ([#12631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12631))
- **Tangled source hosting** domain updated from `tangled.sh` to `tangled.org` in documentation ([#12646](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12646))
- **Documentation structure improved** by moving "dune mental model" to top of explanation section for better onboarding ([#12645](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12645))

summaries.brief_summary: One Directory per Package feature added, Dune self-pinning implemented, Melange improvements, and multiple bug fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Package directory isolation, automatic Dune self-pinning, conflict marker detection, and Melange compilation improvements
summaries.new_features:
- **One Directory per Package** feature introduces `(dir ..)` field in `dune-project` to associate directories with specific packages, enabling automatic filtering with `--only-packages` and preventing package mixing in the same directory ([#12614](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12614))
- **Automatic Dune self-pinning** ensures the running Dune version is used for build plans, preventing incompatibility issues where `dune pkg lock` could select packages incompatible with the installed Dune version ([#12583](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12583))
- **Conflict marker detection** in cram tests now supports Git, diff3, and Jujutsu markers via `(conflict error|ignore)` option, preventing accidental test runs with unresolved conflicts ([#12617](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12617), [#12616](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12616))
- **Melange cmj/cmi rule creation** now parallelized for improved build performance ([#12626](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12626))
- Fixed `include_subdirs qualified` to correctly select the closest module rather than the furthest when resolving name ambiguities ([#12607](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12607), [#12587](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12587))
- Fixed `dune init` to work with absolute paths instead of crashing ([#12601](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12601))
- **OxCaml development environment** added with three Nix devShells for testing bootstrap, building with OxCaml, and running OxCaml test cases ([#12582](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12582))

summaries.brief_summary: Package management search command, concurrent test execution with watch mode, and OxCaml parametric library improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: New `dune pkg search` command for package discovery, concurrent test execution with watch server, and Merlin support for parametric libraries
summaries.new_features:
- **Package search command** `dune pkg search` allows searching through configured repositories by package name using substring or glob patterns ([#12547](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12547))
- **Concurrent test execution** with watch mode server - `dune runtest` can now run while watch mode is active, eliminating the need to stop the server ([#12473](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12473), [#8114](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/8114))
- **OxCaml Merlin configuration** for library parameters - the `-parameter` compiler flag is now properly added to Merlin config files, enabling IDE support for parametric libraries ([#12550](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12550), [#12546](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12546))
- **Dev tools installation** now works without the `LOCK_DEV_TOOL` feature gate - `dune tools install` commands no longer require setting the feature flag ([#12575](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12575), [#12574](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12574))
- **Lock directory validation** - duplicate lock directories and repository definitions are now detected and reported with clear error messages ([#12549](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12549), [#12548](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12548), [#9356](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/9356))
- **Improved variables documentation** - clarified that `ocaml-config:v` uses `ocamlc -config-var` and improved formatting throughout the variables reference ([#12539](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12539))
- **Melange documentation fix** - corrected reference from `subdir` to `dirs` stanza in Melange documentation ([#12596](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12596))

- **`dune tools env` command** to add dev tools to PATH for easier editor integration and terminal workflows ([#12521](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12521))
- **Package dependency reuse** between project and dev tools, preventing unnecessary rebuilding of shared dependencies through package digest-based directory structure ([#12526](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12526))
- **OxCaml parameterized library support** via new `(parameters ...)` field in library stanza, enabling library parameterization with `-parameter` compiler flag ([#12336](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12336))
- **Merlin config generation for library parameters** ensuring proper IDE support for OxCaml parameterized libraries ([#12550](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12550))
- **`dune install --create-install-files` fix** to overwrite read-only opam files, addressing build failures from read-only promoted files ([#12542](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12542))
- **Package build isolation** from project settings to prevent unnecessary compiler rebuilds when changing dune-project version ([#12556](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12556))
- **Duplicate repository name validation** in workspace files to prevent configuration errors ([#12548](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12548))
- **Lint check for changelog entries** ensuring new changes use structured format instead of `.md` files in `doc/changes` ([#12553](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12553))
- **Automatic changelog generation script** from structured `doc/changes` directories supporting release workflow automation ([#12516](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12516))
- **OCaml 5.4 CI support** updating workflows for latest compiler release ([#12552](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12552))
- **Documentation CSS improvements** preventing inline code from wrapping across lines in HTML output ([#12541](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12541))
- **Documentation variable reference improvements** clarifying `ocaml-config:v` expansion behavior ([#12539](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12539))
- **Melange ocamldep rules cleanup** removing unnecessary file copying operations ([#12532](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12532))
- **Single-module ocamldep optimization** skipping transitive dependency computation for buildables with only one module ([#12555](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12555))
- **Melange module cycle test** adding test coverage for cycle detection ([#12554](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12554))

summaries.brief_summary: Package management performance improvements, promoted files now read-only, dev tools expanded with release tooling
summaries.new_features_summary: Promoted files now read-only, dev tools for releasing packages added, package management performance optimized
summaries.new_features:
- **Promoted files are now read-only** to prevent accidental edits to generated files, with dune automatically setting write permissions when needed ([#12519](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12519) by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA))
- **Package release dev tools** `dune-release` and `opam-publish` enrolled as installable dev tools for publishing packages to opam-repository ([#12522](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12522) by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247))
- **Package management performance improvements** for null builds, reducing build times through optimized lockdir parsing and hash computation ([#12248](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12248) via [#12487](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12487), [#12517](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12517), [#12518](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12518) by [@v-gb](https://github.com/v-gb), [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs))
- **Toolchain hash computation** no longer uses generic marshaling, fixing issues where identical toolchains could be rebuilt unnecessarily ([#12495](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12495) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs))
- **Lock directory copying** to build folder before loading, prerequisite for generating lock directories directly in build directory ([#12394](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12394) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV))
- **Documentation improvements** for `dune ocaml top` command explaining toplevel usage and Down support ([#12523](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12523) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV))
summaries.activity_summary: Ongoing work on dev tools environment access, test concurrency, and OxCaml library parameters

summaries.brief_summary: Melange improvements, CLI refactoring, package management optimization, and build system fixes across 19 merged PRs
summaries.new_features_summary: Melange module alias optimization, dependency marshalling fix, CLI module reorganization for qualified subdirs
summaries.new_features:
- **Melange JavaScript compilation** optimization by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) now avoids emitting empty JavaScript files for generated module aliases, improving output cleanliness ([#12464](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12464))
- **Dependency set marshalling** fix by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) resolves incompatibility with recent ocaml-re changes that introduced mutexes, ensuring build cache reliability ([#12509](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12509))
- **CLI module reorganization** refactoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) restructures bin/ directory to use `(include_subdirs qualified)`, improving code organization and enabling better module grouping ([#12478](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12478))
- **Bootstrap system enhancements** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) with improved handling of qualified subdirs without group interface modules and better git-free environments ([#12486](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12486), [#12479](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12479))
- **Package management performance** improvement by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) removes backtracking from lockdir parsing, reducing build startup time significantly ([#12487](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12487))

- **Empty alias** feature introduced - new `@empty` alias contains no targets, useful for scripting scenarios where conditional builds need a "do nothing" option ([#11556](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11556), [#11952](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11952), [#11955](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11955), [#11956](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11956))

summaries.brief_summary: Package management improvements with zip archive support and version constraint fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Added zip archive extraction and improved local package version handling for package management
summaries.new_features:
- **ZIP archive support** for package dependencies with fallback extraction strategies using `unzip`, `bsdtar`, or `tar` commands ([9bdbdaae880](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9bdbdaae880c6d97390c7c16d43ea4e307c0992d))
- **Archive driver abstraction** with unified interface for extracting tar and zip formats, supporting compressed tarballs (.tar.gz, .tgz, .tar.bz2, .tbz) and zip files ([9bdbdaae880](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9bdbdaae880c6d97390c7c16d43ea4e307c0992d))
- **Enhanced version constraint handling** for local packages, with automatic `dev` version assignment when no version is specified and proper solver integration ([6d1e608f7b](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/6d1e608f7b029a87aa0683ca88fe78a9d825375d))
- **Cache permissions test** infrastructure to reproduce directory target permission issues in build cache ([0a80aa31be](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/0a80aa31be17da749a2f0959cba008a41239995f))
summaries.activity_summary: Package management system enhancements focused on archive format support and version constraint resolution
summaries.activity:
- **Package management infrastructure** improvements by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) with comprehensive zip archive support implementation ([9bdbdaae880](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9bdbdaae880c6d97390c7c16d43ea4e307c0992d)) and [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) fixing version constraint handling for local packages ([6d1e608f7b](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/6d1e608f7b029a87aa0683ca88fe78a9d825375d))
- **Archive extraction capabilities** expanded with new `Archive_driver` module supporting both tar and zip formats, including intelligent format detection based on file extensions and fallback extraction strategies when preferred tools are unavailable
- **Local package version semantics** refined to use `dev` version by default when no explicit version is specified, improving solver compatibility and enabling proper constraint resolution for self-referencing packages
- **Test infrastructure** enhanced by [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) with cache permissions reproduction test ([0a80aa31be](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/0a80aa31be17da749a2f0959cba008a41239995f)) addressing directory target permission issues
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on package management robustness with archive format diversity and version constraint edge cases
summaries.emerging_trends:

- **Version constraint robustness** improvements addressing edge cases in local package handling, particularly around self-referencing dependencies and default version assignment for packages without explicit versioning
- **Build system reliability** enhancements with dedicated test infrastructure for reproducing and fixing cache-related permission issues that affect directory targets in complex build scenarios

summaries.activity_summary: Heavy refactoring week focused on package management optimizations, opam solver improvements, and internal architecture cleanup
summaries.activity:
- **Package management refactoring** delivered major improvements including opam buffer reuse for parsing ([#11302](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11302)), specialized string functions for parser string cache ([#11350](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11350)), and buffer string reading optimizations ([#11301](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11301))
- **Concurrent opam solver** implementation completed with fiber-based concurrent loading of opam files ([#11362](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11362)), replacing table with fiber cache for better performance
- **Internal architecture cleanup** including removal of unused mutex code ([#11454](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11454)), opam solver cleanups ([#11439](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11439)), and unused package manager code removal ([#11459](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11459))
- **Build system updates** with Nix flake update to OCaml 5.2 ([#11458](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11458)) and CI improvements removing unsupported compiler versions ([#11449](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11449))
summaries.trends_summary: Strong focus on performance optimization and package manager reliability with concurrent processing and memory efficiency improvements

summaries.activity_summary: Major Dune 3.17.0 release published with comprehensive new features and Windows package management planning
summaries.activity:
- **Dune 3.17.0 release** published by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) featuring extensive new capabilities including wasm_of_ocaml support, Dune cache enabled by default, and enhanced JavaScript compilation control
- **Windows package management** initiative launched by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) with comprehensive tracking issue identifying 10+ specific areas requiring Windows support ([#11161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11161))
- **New compiler flag support** for OCaml 5.2's `-H` flag enabling correct semantics for `(implicit_transitive_deps false)` in this release
- **Enhanced development tools** including individual test running with `dune runtest mytest.t`, Codeberg repository support, and project defaults configuration
- **Performance and usability** improvements with new cache settings, improved terminal color readability, and configurator enhancements
summaries.trends_summary: Focus shifting toward cross-platform compatibility and enhanced developer experience with package management improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform package management** becoming a priority with dedicated Windows support initiative tracking multiple related issues and binary distribution requirements
- **Enhanced developer tooling** with new testing capabilities, configuration options, and improved integration with external tools like wasm_of_ocaml
- **Default behavior modernization** including enabling Dune cache by default and updating project initialization to reflect current best practices
summaries.contributors_summary: Etienne led the 3.17.0 release while Stephen Sherratt opened Windows package management planning issue
summaries.contributors:
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) published both the 3.17.0 alpha and final releases, coordinating the delivery of major new features including wasm_of_ocaml support and default cache enablement
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) opened comprehensive Windows package management tracking issue ([#11161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11161)) identifying specific areas requiring development across multiple repositories
